intro: Camissonia kernensis subsp. kernensis, commonly known as the Kern's camissonia, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often in areas with full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower clusters. This subspecies is adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of the southern Sierra Nevada region.
